name: Santa Ana (Castilla y Leon)
description:
Introduction

The following description was translated from UnoDeAventuras.com by Google Translate:

This interesting ravine; located in the Sierra de Madrid; He had unnoticed for some years. Now that it begins to be traveled by some groups of mountaineers and athletes it is important to highlight that it is located in one of the maximum protection areas of the National Park of the Sierra de Guadarrama. It is a mountain stream with eight small rappels (maximum 17 meters); some of them between large granite blocks. We also find a couple of deep Badinas with the possibility of jumping (prior verification) and all this interspersed with short sections of progression with highlights. His short access and return make him ideal to flee from the hot days of Madrid.

Approach

Descent

Exit

Red tape

The descent passes through the area of restricted use type B according to the annex of the Governing Plan for the Use and Management of the National Park of the Sierra de Guadarrama (PRUG - Decree 18/2020 of the Community of Madrid). It is not specifically regulated in the activity of the descent of cannons or canyon; although according to its article 29: "Restricted use zone. In the restricted use zones, public access is allowed only by existing paths and authorized mountain itineraries; being prohibited by the rest of the territory". Therefore; according to applicable legislation; Your descent is prohibited.
